bcbioSingleCell

  • News

Calculate Cellular Barcode Metrics Summary

Calculate Cellular Barcode Metrics Summary

calculateMetrics(object, ...)

# S4 method for dgCMatrix
calculateMetrics(object, annotable, prefilter = TRUE)

# S4 method for bcbioSingleCell
calculateMetrics(object, prefilter = TRUE)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments (for the S4 generic definition).
annotable

Annotable.
prefilter

Whether to apply pre-filtering to the cellular barcodes.

Value

data.frame.

Note

This should only be performed during the initial run loading.

Examples

bcb <- examples[["bcb"]]
calculateMetrics(bcb) %>% glimpse()
#> Recalculating cellular barcode metrics
#> Calculating barcode metrics
#> 18240 cellular barcodes detected
#> 13 mitochondrial genes detected
#> 18240 cellular barcodes passed pre-filtering (100%)
#> Observations: 18,240
#> Variables: 6
#> $ nUMI             <dbl> 9659, 14095, 14053, 10666, 12359, 12660, 12909, 80...
#> $ nGene            <int> 3223, 4230, 4146, 3178, 3891, 4275, 3916, 2998, 37...
#> $ nCoding          <dbl> 8732, 12405, 11895, 9926, 11261, 11627, 11533, 687...
#> $ nMito            <dbl> 290, 781, 1251, 190, 338, 410, 476, 843, 479, 324,...
#> $ log10GenesPerUMI <dbl> 0.8803814, 0.8740139, 0.8721868, 0.8694520, 0.8773...
#> $ mitoRatio        <dbl> 0.03002381, 0.05540972, 0.08902014, 0.01781361, 0....
